alert.note: Alert for Blount (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 3:31PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Blount County through 430 PM CDT... At 331 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles west of Arab to near Hanceville to near Bangor. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Oneonta, Blountsville, Cleveland, Locust Fork, Snead, Susan Moore, Allgood, Fairview, Nectar, Rosa, McLarty, Blount Springs, Bangor, Strawberry, Brooksville, Easley, Chamblees Mill, Fowler Spring and Hendrix. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central Alabama.
